origin.a: I was born like really far away, farther than the distance between my feelings about you and your about me.
origin.b: My home was the meeting point of many winds, they carried me to no land I wanted to stay.
origin.c: Nothing happened where I grew up, I couldn't even have imagined a party with so many different creatures.

goal.a: What are you supposed even do at a party?  I liked hanging out with the television.
goal.b: It seems like there's a contest to be the most lonely creature in idtio.
goal.c: In this mirror world or whatever is everyone just like more chill?  Because I would be into that.

obstacle.a: I heard that the smell is really fowl, like the farting trees in the east but worse.
obstacle.b: It was a good party, but like, I don't know, am I going to have to feel bad about who I talk to every time these idiots are in one place?
obstacle.c: If we were friends for one thousandth of one second or a thousand years, what's the difference?

reward.a: If I have to look for something, I guess I'd like to find myself.
reward.b: The pig keeps talking about this land under idtio that's like the veins under our skin, which is gross.
reward.c: And the birds just talk about the meaning of life or whatever being like bowels.  I don't know if it's supposed to be funny.

origin.a: The earth is dry and acidic in my home land, a neglected, boring place.
origin.b: As an child I swam in the yellow waters of the south, and I dreamed to swim around the world to the north but I don't know if it works like that.
origin.c: I came from a big litter of pigs and I was the biggest of all.

goal.a: I have suffered long in my search for beauty, in the form of both creature and thoughts, like thoughts about beauty.
goal.b: There's no more confounding creature than the television, with whom the cat is always whispering.  I lose sleep wondering what they discuss.
goal.c: Of course, I've communed with all the creatures in this land, I've listened to their tales and related my own.

obstacle.a: Is true love real? It's the question that no one in this land can satisfy with an answer.
obstacle.b: Another mystery, over which I have cried for days: why does everyone act like they don't remember me?
obstacle.c: Love is like the void myth.  It smells like falsehood.

reward.a: I'll go to the void only if it will reveal to me the thoughts of the most famous mystery, the cat.
reward.b: I should convene and converse with the fruit, who I haven't seen since the party.
reward.c: Is it noble to be alone? Can one find love without first knowing isolation?

origin.a: I grew up in the dense forest in the east.
origin.b: I'm from the east, where trees begin and the desert ends.
origin.c: I was happy living in the forest when I was younger, I felt I belonged.

goal.a: I left the forest, following a beautiful and filthy creature across the rock path and into the hills, I thought that it was love.
goal.b: I heard myths of an emotion called love in the whirring sounds of the bugs in the forest.
goal.c: One day I will build a nest.

obstacle.a: Do you know what love is?  Is it like the illuminating sunrise?  Is like the endless ocean?
obstacle.b: It was like we were two boats at sea going toward each other and then the cat just feel asleep and drifted away.
obstacle.c: I could fly across the sea but I'm held back by some nameless emotion rooted in my bowels.

reward.a: The void sounds like a lonely place to me.
reward.b: What if I get to the void and there's no one else there? What if I can't leave?
reward.c: In the forest they say the void is just a story, a denial of love, a refusal of discovery, a rejection of reciprocity.

origin.a: I was born in the south in the shadow of the oldest tree in idtio.
origin.b: In that curve of land the young become old.
origin.c: My home is a smelly place, it reeks of age and decay.

goal.a: The party was like a lot of staring, like thousands of eyes cast in shadow, their gaze taking up any space where you could move.
goal.b: I heard the cat wouldn't talk to anyone which doesn't surprise me the cat wants everyone to feel like they have to be the one to approach but like no one cares.
goal.c: The pig, he waved at me, from literally the same room, like he was making nautical signs from a distance vessel.

obstacle.a: I feel I would be fine like not knowing where everyone is from and where they're going, every creature is from somewhere and we're all going nowhere.
obstacle.b: I know we have to talk because there's nothing else to do but we could talk about the waves in the ocean, or the colors in the sunset or even the breeze that scatters leaves around the trees instead a stupid smelly void.
obstacle.c: Sorry I didn't see you waving.

reward.a: If the void is real the pig will find it and I'd rather continue wandering the desert than be stuck in made up mythical mirror world with that pig.
reward.b: I'll wait here. I'll see you later.
reward.c: It's a lie made up by a devious creature, and that's what I will continue to say even if it's not true.

origin.a: I was born probably in the dark dirt.
origin.b: I could have come from anywhere, I emerged from dirt and then I was blinded by the endless sun.
origin.c: I had to study for years under the wisest of worms to escape the dark dirt.

goal.a: The party with all the creatures was a wonderful achievement of camaraderie which I captured with my pen of the darkest ink on the most delicate of plant based papers.
goal.b: Through my lifetime of suffering in squalor I learned to appreciate the beauty of limbful creatures in their world.
goal.c: Through art and through seeing I capture the secrets of the creatures of this land.

obstacle.a: And the creatures look down at me and I see them thinking, 'Oh you're a worm.'
obstacle.b: I can see it in the eyes of my beloved, 'You're disgusting.'
obstacle.c: My insides are visible through my translucent skin, it distracts the creatures of this world, the stare at me as though I were a nauseating entertainment.

reward.a: I can enter the world below the surface, I can dig through graves and unearth secrets.
reward.b: I've seen death, I've tasted it and painted it.
reward.c: In the void I will paint the beautiful fruit, the only creature that could understand me, as my final portrait.

origin.a: I never left the house, until it burned down.
origin.b: The house was good for parties, I didn't really know where everyone else went otherwise.
origin.c: The house was burned down so I guess I'm not from anywhere anymore.

goal.a: It was not long ago that I was the source of light in darkness, where the creatures gathered to be together.
goal.b: Everyone is searching for some mythic void, a portal, a inversion of light and dark, because my home was burned down.
goal.c: I feel lonely outside in the changeless air, in search of some stinking hole.

obstacle.a: How was I to know the pig was so obsessed with those creatures?  I wanted only to entertain my guests like a good host.
obstacle.b: The era of hanging out with everyone has passed and so I pass my days walking back and forth across the stones dividing the land of idtio, waiting for them to give up searching for the endless darkness, the inverted light.
obstacle.c: I can't forget the screams of the creatures I heard as the flames found their way upstairs, they echo in my empty head like bats in a cave.

reward.a: I want to be with the birds and their beautiful song, I could listen forever.
reward.b: I want to be with the worm and watch the ink spread across each pleasing portrait.
reward.c: I want to chill with the cat, the chillest creature who ever chilled.

origin.a: I'm from the deserted lands beyond the house and two hills.
origin.b: As a child, nothing happened, so I learned to entertain myself with verses, what became the endless verse.
origin.c: The endless heat of the son was my parent and the endless darkness of night was my other parent.

goal.a: I used every word that exists to describe the sun, and the heat, and the night, and the cold.  I seek more words in the mirror world.
goal.b: I will write a new verse in the inverted void.
goal.c: I'm the prickly poet, have you heard my famous verse, the song of the pricked creatures?

obstacle.a: I've written on anything that can be seen and anything that can be imagined.  Is there anything that can't be seen and can't be imagined?
obstacle.b: My endless verse is my endless companion, no creature could compare.
obstacle.c: I have been asked what is the point of a poem.

reward.a: Of the birds I would write a verse of aloofity, about waiting behind a wall of stagnation, waiting for any other creature to cross that turbulent river of desolation.
reward.b: Of the pig a bombastic ballad, a rueful lyric, a stupid haiku, on a pig eating poop.
reward.c: Of the cat a quatrain of sadness, subtract one line for the words never spoken, and another for the looks unreturned, so a couplet like the couplets refused with creatures far and wide and especially, fantasticly far.

origin.a: I spawned in the North Sea ten years before the ten year party.
origin.b: For years the other fish told me that no one would come to the sea so reluctantly I made my way to the land.
origin.c: In childhood I was too busy swimming for my life to make friends.

goal.a: I only really hate one creature, a vile, slimy, legless worm.
goal.b: I know that my time with the television was the most comfortable for me but I also know the television will never be happy with just the fish.
goal.c: I don't want to talk about the party.  I'm over it.  We live in a vast land of mystery and sadness and that party ended ten years ago.

obstacle.a: My heart is pulled between sorrow and joy like the waves push and pull and break on the land.
obstacle.b: Even if I wanted to I couldn't stop caring about the feelings of every creature.
obstacle.c: If I wonder about if ever should have left the sea, which I do, I won't be able to go on.

reward.a: If they find death before the void these creatures will continue to wallow in their stupid sorrow, but they don't know death and the void are one and the same.
reward.b: The land is so dry.  The sun is so hot.  Why doesn't anyone love me?
reward.c: I know I can't find love in the sea.  But there's supposed to be love on land.

origin.a: I think I grew up in a pile of garbage for a while, I don't know where it was.  My parents didn't really talk about our family history.
origin.b: I don't really remember anything that happened before yesterday, or today.
origin.c: I remember the hunger of childhood like the hunger I feel now.  Have you eaten?

goal.a: I've lived through worse than the party fire, and I keep on living for whatever reason.
goal.b: Like the worm I've lived in dirt and worse, but I didn't become a pretentious turd.
goal.c: My memories rot like garbage in the sun, if I found the void I wouldn't even remember if I was in the void or outside of it.

obstacle.a: The legless fish sees the legless worm and thinks they are the same but the fish doesn't understand what it means to come from dirt like me.
obstacle.b: I was pummeled and buffeted by the mysterious blank eyed cat before the house was over taken by flames.
obstacle.c: To reach the party I walked for years across desert, grass and mud.  I took up residence in the bodies of decaying animals that never made it to survive the cold nights and devastating days.

reward.a: When I die and the sun bakes away my flesh my skull will point in the direction of the void.
reward.b: If I die alone, unburied, I will fulfill the prophesy made by my parents in their home of garbage.
reward.c: Is there a more noble quest than to just hang out and forget what has come before and ignore what will come after?
